requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: A potential customer visiting the cleaning service website for the first time.
user_goal: To view the list of available cleaning services without seeing any hardcoded content.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Services Page
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the website homepage and clicks on the 'Services' link in the navigation bar to see what cleaning options are available.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Services' navigation link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The services page loads dynamically, displaying a grid of cleaning service cards fetched from the backend API.

requirement_tested: A backend application connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer setting up the application locally.
user_goal: To confirm that the backend successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database using the correct environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: Alex sets the required environment variables and starts the backend server to verify database connectivity.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server after setting DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend server starts successfully and logs a message indicating successful connection to the PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: Service browsing functionality displaying available cleaning services
user_persona: A homeowner looking for a reliable cleaning service.
user_goal: To browse through the list of available cleaning services on the website.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Services Page
narrative_steps.description: Maria visits the website and wants to explore the types of cleaning services offered. She clicks on the 'Services' menu item.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Services' menu item.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Maria is taken to the services page where she sees a grid of service cards with names, brief descriptions, and starting prices on an azure mist background.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting a Service
narrative_steps.description: She finds a service called 'Deep Cleaning' interesting and clicks on its card to learn more.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Deep Cleaning' service card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Maria is redirected to the detailed service page for 'Deep Cleaning'.

requirement_tested: Detailed service pages showing descriptions, pricing, and duration
user_persona: A busy professional wanting to understand what each service includes.
user_goal: To view comprehensive details about a specific cleaning service.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Detailed Service Information
narrative_steps.description: John has clicked on a service card and now wants to know exactly what the 'Move-Out Cleaning' service entails, including cost and time commitment.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the 'Move-Out Cleaning' detailed service page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page displays the full description, exact price, and duration in minutes with dark slate blue headers against an azure mist background.

requirement_tested: Booking system allowing users to schedule cleaning services
user_persona: A returning customer who previously used the service.
user_goal: To book a regular cleaning appointment online.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Booking Process
narrative_steps.description: Emily likes the 'Regular Cleaning' service and decides to book it. She clicks the 'Book Now' button on the service page.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Book Now' button on the 'Regular Cleaning' service page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A booking form modal appears, pre-filled with the selected service information.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Date and Submitting Booking
narrative_steps.description: Emily enters her email, selects a date using the calendar picker, and submits the form.
narrative_steps.action: Enter email address, click the date picker to select a date, and click the 'Submit' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The form validates the inputs, sends the booking data to the backend, and displays a confirmation message.

requirement_tested: User interface for checking the status of booked services
user_persona: A customer who recently booked a service and wants to track its progress.
user_goal: To check the current status of a previously booked cleaning service.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Status Check Page
narrative_steps.description: David remembers he booked a service last week and wants to confirm if it's still scheduled. He goes to the service status page.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the service status page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page displays an input field for entering a booking ID and a 'Check Status' button.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Booking Status
narrative_steps.description: He enters his booking ID and clicks the 'Check Status' button.
narrative_steps.action: Enter booking ID into the input field and click 'Check Status'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system fetches and displays the booking details and current status (e.g., confirmed) in a card layout.

requirement_tested: Contact page providing phone number and email address for customer service
user_persona: A new customer with questions about service availability.
user_goal: To get in touch with customer service via phone or email.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Contact Information
narrative_steps.description: Lisa wants to ask about weekend availability and navigates to the contact page to find how to reach customer service.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Contact Us' link in the footer.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The contact page loads, showing the phone number and email address with respective icons, styled with dark slate blue text on azure mist background.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Communication
narrative_steps.description: She decides to call and clicks the phone number link.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the displayed phone number.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: On her mobile device, the phone app opens ready to dial the number.

requirement_tested: Inquiry form for users to submit service-related questions
user_persona: A potential customer with specific questions about service packages.
user_goal: To submit a question about customized cleaning packages.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Out Inquiry Form
narrative_steps.description: Robert wants to inquire about customizing a cleaning package for his office. He fills out the inquiry form with his details and question.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in name, email, subject, and message fields in the inquiry form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All fields accept input and the submit button becomes active.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Inquiry
narrative_steps.description: After reviewing his message, Robert clicks the submit button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button on the inquiry form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The form validates inputs, sends the inquiry to the backend API, and displays a success message.

requirement_tested: Responsive website design with azure mist background color
user_persona: A mobile user browsing services during a commute.
user_goal: To navigate the website easily on a smartphone with consistent styling.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Website on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Sophia opens the cleaning service website on her smartphone while commuting and expects a seamless experience.
narrative_steps.action: Open the website URL on a mobile browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The website loads with an azure mist background and responsive layout that adapts to the small screen size.

requirement_tested: Dark slate blue color applied to interactive components and headers
user_persona: A visually-oriented user who appreciates good design aesthetics.
user_goal: To interact with visually distinct buttons and headers that match the brand theme.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Visual Design Elements
narrative_steps.description: Michael browses the website and notices the consistent use of dark slate blue for buttons and headers which makes them stand out.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate through various pages observing headers and interactive elements.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All interactive elements including buttons, form inputs, and headers are consistently styled with dark slate blue color.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with `install:all` script for FE & BE dependencies
user_persona: A new team member setting up the project for the first time.
user_goal: To install all frontend and backend dependencies with a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Running Installation Script
narrative_steps.description: James clones the repository and wants to quickly set up both frontend and backend environments.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dependencies for both frontend and backend applications are installed successfully without errors.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with `dev` script to start FE & BE concurrently
user_persona: A developer beginning daily work on the project.
user_goal: To start both frontend and backend development servers simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Patricia is ready to begin coding and needs both frontend and backend servers running for local development.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend development servers start concurrently, and the application is accessible in the browser.

requirement_tested: Database schema supporting service listings, bookings, and inquiries
user_persona: A database administrator tasked with verifying schema correctness.
user_goal: To ensure the database schema matches the application's data requirements.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Database Tables
narrative_steps.description: Thomas reviews the database schema to confirm it supports all required entities: services, bookings, and inquiries.
narrative_steps.action: Examine the database schema creation scripts.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The schema includes properly defined tables for services, bookings, and inquiries with appropriate fields, primary keys, foreign keys, and constraints.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for retrieving service data and submitting bookings
user_persona: A frontend developer integrating with backend services.
user_goal: To consume backend APIs for displaying services and submitting bookings.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Service Data
narrative_steps.description: Nina is building the services listing page and needs to retrieve all available services from the backend.
narrative_steps.action: Make a GET request to the /api/services endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The API returns a JSON array of all available cleaning services with their details.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting a New Booking
narrative_steps.description: She then implements the booking submission feature by sending a new booking request.
narrative_steps.action: Make a POST request to the /api/bookings endpoint with valid booking data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The API validates the data, creates a new booking record, and returns a success response with the booking ID.

requirement_tested: API endpoint for handling service status requests
user_persona: A customer support agent assisting clients with booking inquiries.
user_goal: To look up the status of a customer's booking using its unique identifier.

narrative_steps.title: Requesting Booking Status
narrative_steps.description: Agent Chris receives a call from a customer asking about their booking status and needs to look it up in the system.
narrative_steps.action: Make a GET request to the /api/bookings/{id} endpoint with a specific booking ID.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The API returns the booking details including current status (e.g., confirmed, pending).
